channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As federal funds wane, NPR ruefully clashes with CPB

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to withhold $4 billion in foreign aid
item.description: The court's majority said Trump's foreign policy authority outweighed the harms claimed by the international aid groups suing.

item.title: Des Moines Schools Superintendent Ian Roberts Detained by ICE, Officials Say

item.title: Trump Can’t Be the One to Pick Who’s Indicted
item.description: The Justice Department and the attorney general are supposed to keep a distance from the president, not be his personal score settlers.

item.title: Russia and China Fail to Delay U.N. ‘Snapback’ Sanctions Against Iran Over Nuclear Program
item.description: The unsuccessful bid to put off the sanctions for six months over Iran’s nuclear program means they would go into effect early Sunday in Iran.

item.title: Trump Believes ‘We Have a Deal’ on Gaza. But a Host of Obstacles Remain.
item.description: Whether President Trump can help bring the war to an end will probably depend on how much he is willing to push Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: There was a different vibe at the U.N. General Assembly. 5 attendees weigh in
item.description: It's the first high level U.N. gathering since the U.S. foreign aid cuts under the Trump Administration. What were people thinking — and talking about...

item.title: An influx of federal agents will arrive in Memphis next week, governor says
item.description: Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee said National Guard troops will serve in support roles to local law enforcement and not be tasked with making arrests.

item.title: Assata Shakur, a fugitive Black militant sought by the U.S. since 1979, dies in Cuba
